acidity.notes: Smooth. Not glowing. Just slightly sour and watery, but more like a blueberry/blueberry picked when it's still reddish. Fruit increases to a pungent cherry/alkaline flavor as coffee cools.

sweetness.notes: Not developed, but definitely some smoothness/creaminess.

body.notes: Tea-like, but the smoothness tricks my mouth into thinking it's much thicker.

finish.notes: Little to no finish. Fairly neutral mouthfeel. Mouth feels sticky but not dry/sandpapery.

flavor: First sip was clean, no tang/bitterness, a conservative grape note, and a smooth mouthfeel. Finish disappears but leaves mouth sticky/parched, indicating sourness rather than astringency. Overall, I liked where this was going â€” it was focused and on its way to well-balanced and glowy. No 'off tastes' or juxtaposition of sourness and astringency.
observations: High initial pour, first pour a little slow, got to 200g at 1:05, accidentally overshot at 375g, took off filter early at 3:08 to compensate. Drawdown was very slow.
actionItem: A little faster initial pour, end by 1:00.
